metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5368 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
phpMyAdmin 3.5.x before 3.5.3 uses JavaScript code that is obtained through an HTTP session to phpmyadmin.net without SSL, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks by modifying this code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:3.5.8.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:3.5.8.1-1').
